verb.description: To undo the meshes of (a net).
To remove or empty out (fish) from the meshes of a net. Also occasionally without object. Compare "mesh".
Of the teeth of a cog, a gear, etc.: to disengage.
To cause (a gear, cog, etc.) to become disengaged.

origin: Mid 19th century. From un- + mesh. Compare earlier unmeshed.
